title: International Criminal Court (ICC) Quiz
description: Test your knowledge about the International Criminal Court (ICC) and its mission.

questions.question: What is the main mission of the ICC?
questions.correct_answer: To hold accountable people responsible for the worst crimes globally
wrong_answers: To provide legal aid to refugees

questions.question: How many judges does the ICC have?
Does the ICC have its own police force?
questions.correct_answer: No, it relies on member countries to apprehend suspects
wrong_answers: Yes, it has a dedicated police force
It borrows police forces from the United Nations

questions.question: What is the main difference between the ICC and the ICJ?
questions.correct_answer: ICC prosecutes criminals, ICJ settles disputes between States
wrong_answers: ICC focuses on civil cases, ICJ on criminal cases
ICC is a regional court, ICJ is a global court
ICC only deals with domestic cases, ICJ with international cases

questions.question: What can the ICC issue to apprehend suspects?
On what basis can the ICC open cases on countries?
questions.correct_answer: Member countries and sometimes nonmember countries
wrong_answers: At the request of the United Nations

questions.question: What type of court did the ICC aim to create?
questions.correct_answer: Permanent and efficient court for trying global crimes
wrong_answers: Temporary and slow court for local crimes

questions.question: Who is responsible for apprehending suspects for the ICC?
Does the ICC have jurisdiction over nonmember countries?
wrong_answers: Only with explicit permission from the United Nations

questions.question: What is the total number of judges in the ICC?
